Package org.mvplugins.multiverse.core.utils

Class StringFormatter

java.lang.Object
org.mvplugins.multiverse.core.utils.StringFormatter
public final class StringFormatter extends Object
Common string formatting methods used throughout Multiverse plugins.

  • Method Details

    • joinAnd

      @NotNull public static @NotNull String joinAnd(@Nullable @Nullable List<String> list)
      Concatenates a list of strings into a single string, using a comma and a space as separators, and " and " as the separator before the last element.
      This method is useful for creating human-readable lists, such as "John, Mary and David".
      Parameters:
      list - the list of strings to join. If the list is empty, an empty string is returned.
      Returns:
      the concatenated string

    • join

      @NotNull public static @NotNull String join(@Nullable @Nullable Collection<?> list, @NotNull @NotNull String separator)

    • join

      @NotNull public static @NotNull String join(@Nullable @Nullable List<String> list, @NotNull @NotNull String separator, @NotNull @NotNull String lastSeparator)
      Concatenates a list of strings into a single string, using a specified separator and a different separator for the last element.
      Parameters:
      list - the list of strings to join. If the list is empty, an empty string is returned.
      separator - the separator to use between elements, except for the last one. For example, a comma and a space.
      lastSeparator - the separator to use before the last element. For example, " and ".
      Returns:
      the concatenated string

    • addonToCommaSeperated

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true, since="5.5") @ScheduledForRemoval(inVersion="6.0") public static Collection<String> addonToCommaSeperated(@Nullable @Nullable String input, @NotNull @NotNull Collection<String> addons)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      Method name has a spelling error. Use addOnToCommaSeparated(String, Collection) instead.
      Appends a list of suggestions to the end of the input string, separated by commas.
      Parameters:
      input - The current input
      addons - The autocomplete suggestions
      Returns:
      A collection of suggestions with the next suggestion appended

    • addOnToCommaSeparated

      @AvailableSince("5.5") public static Collection<String> addOnToCommaSeparated(@Nullable @Nullable String input, @NotNull @NotNull Collection<String> addons)
      Appends a list of suggestions to the end of the input string, separated by commas.
      Parameters:
      input - The current input
      addons - The autocomplete suggestions
      Returns:
      A collection of suggestions with the next suggestion appended
      Since:
      5.5

    • parseQuotesInArgs

      @NotNull public static @NotNull Collection<String> parseQuotesInArgs(@NotNull @NotNull String[] args)
      Parse quotes in args into a single string. E.g. ["\"my", "string\""] -> ["my string"]
      Parameters:
      args - The args to parse
      Returns:
      The parsed args

    • quoteMultiWordString

      @Contract("null -> null") @Nullable public static @Nullable String quoteMultiWordString(@Nullable @Nullable String input)
      Add quotes to a string if it contains spaces. E.g. "my string" -> "\"my string\"". Gives back the original string if it doesn't contain spaces.
      Parameters:
      input - The string to add quotes to
      Returns:
      The quoted string

    • parseCSVMap

      @AvailableSince("5.5") public static @Unmodifiable Map<String,String> parseCSVMap(@Nullable @Nullable String input)
      Parses a CSV string of key=value pairs into a map. E.g. "key1=value1,key2=value2" -> {key1=value1, key2=value2}
      Parameters:
      input - The CSV string to parse
      Returns:
      The parsed map
      Since:
      5.5
